It is then taken to the factory, by tanker, to be pasturised and cleaned and put into bottles which are then sold for about 20p. A cow may produce up to 15 to 20 litres per day when it has just calved. The Milk Marketing Board pay a fixed price to every farmer. At the moment a farmer will be paid 10.2p a litre. The land that is not being used for cattle is used for growing fodder for the winter, such as peas, kale, oats, wheat, and silage (which is gathered 3 times a year).
